Interface ec.ez.prim.Deliverator

public interface Deliverator
Objects that handle EZ message delivery requests themselves.

BROKEN
FORWARDED
KEPT
STATE_NAMES
UNRESOLVED

deliver(String, Object[], Resolver)
Should this promise be or become KEPT, ensure that the resolution() be asked to perform.
ignore()
For ignoring errors on purpose.
optProblem()
If BROKEN, this returns the reason.
resolution()
If UNRESOLVED, this returns itself (or another Deliverator equivalent to itself but possibly more efficient).
state()
One of UNRESOLVED, KEPT, or BROKEN.

UNRESOLVED 
 public static final int UNRESOLVED
KEPT 
 public static final int KEPT
BROKEN 
 public static final int BROKEN
FORWARDED 
 public static final int FORWARDED
See Also:
Resolver
STATE_NAMES 
 public static final String STATE_NAMES[]

state 
 public abstract int state()
One of UNRESOLVED, KEPT, or BROKEN. May not be FORWARDED.

resolution 
 public abstract Object resolution()
If UNRESOLVED, this returns itself (or another Deliverator equivalent to itself but possibly more efficient).

If KEPT, this returns a non-Deliverator.

If BROKEN, this throws a NestedException containing the problem.

optProblem 
 public abstract Throwable optProblem()
If BROKEN, this returns the reason. Otherwise null.

deliver 
 public abstract void deliver(String verb,
                              Object args[],
                              Resolver optResolver)
Should this promise be or become KEPT, ensure that the resolution() be asked to perform. Should this promise be or become BROKEN before this happens, ensure that 'resolver' is notified of the problem.

'optResolver' must be UNRESOLVED. When deliver() returns, 'optResolver' will no longer be UNRESOLVED (i.e., deliver() forward()s 'resolver'). A null resolver means no one cares about the answer.

ignore 
 public abstract void ignore()
For ignoring errors on purpose. Currently does nothing. Eventually, we expect to be able to trace all broken promises that get finalized without their errors either being examined or ignore()d.
